duties_responsibilities.duty: Makes daily funding decisions and reviews daily transactions for accuracy and risk issues.
Manages collateral performance and conducts client and portfolio reviews.
Monitors statistical trends and financial performance of clients, taking appropriate action if needed.
Maintains proper client risk ratings and makes decisions on collection and verification call levels and coverage.
Formulates an exit strategy if needed to minimize potential losses.
Recover funds advanced in a collect-out situation and ensures all chargeable fees are processed when required.
Assists in field exams if required and undertakes client visits if necessary.
Maintains client risk ratings and ensures client terms are set up correctly.
Provides continuous support to Collateral Analysts and Data Entry teams.
Undertakes other related duties and tasks as necessary.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in a business-related field preferred.
Five to 10 years Factoring and/or ABL experience with a financial institution.
Computer literate with excellent keyboarding skills and competency with Microsoft Office; ability to learn new systems quickly.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills required, strong customer service.
